comments.author: jhoneill
comments.body:
You may want to look at https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/17390 

As of today, we do have Linux PowerShell to PowerShell 7 on Windows via SSH, this doesn't support the remote session configurations used by JEA etc. 

As far as I can see, there are two cases where WINRM is needed, where the Windows machine can't (for whatever reason) support pwsh7 and ssh, or it can but the commands which need to be run won't work in PowerShell 7, and double hopping from pwsh 7 to Windows PowerShell isn't an acceptable workround. 

The number of people who can't use the ssh solution is thought to be too small to take on the large task of implementing WinRM on linux.
